title: Particle Motion - position on the plane

content.question: In the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane, the position of a particle at time <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> is given by the parametric function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> defined by <math alttext="f open parentheses t close parentheses equals open parentheses x open parentheses t close parentheses comma y open parentheses t close parentheses close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math> for <math alttext="t greater or equal than 0"><mi>t</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>0</mn></math> seconds. If <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses equals t squared minus 4"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn></math> and <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses equals t squared minus 16"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>16</mn></math>, which of the following describes the position of the particle at time <math alttext="t equals 3"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math> ?

choices.label: The particle is in Quadrant I.
The particle is in Quadrant II.
The particle is in Quadrant III.
The particle is in Quadrant IV.

content.answer: The particle is in Quadrant IV.

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe the characteristics of a function with varying levels of precision, depending on the function representation and available mathematical tools.
